briefdescription.para: Obsolete accessor to the RegionHandler.PingImplementation.

memberdef.name: paramDictionaryPool
memberdef.initializer: = new Pool<ParameterDictionary>( () => new ParameterDictionary(), x => x.Clear(), 1)

briefdescription.para: Creates a Peer with specified connection protocol.

detaileddescription.para: You need to set the Listener before using the peer.
Each connection protocol has it's own default networking ports for Photon.

parameterdescription.para: The preferred option is UDP.

briefdescription.para: Creates a Peer with specified connection protocol and a Listener for callbacks.
Joins the lobby on the Master Server, where you get a list of RoomInfos of currently open rooms.

detaileddescription.para: This is an async request which triggers a OnOperationResponse() call.

parameterdescription.para: The lobby join to.

simplesect.para: If the operation could be sent (has to be connected).

briefdescription.para: Leaves the lobby on the Master Server.

detaileddescription.para: This is an async request which triggers a OnOperationResponse() call.

simplesect.para: If the operation could be sent (requires connection).

briefdescription.para: Creates a room (on either Master or Game Server).

detaileddescription.para: The OperationResponse depends on the server the peer is connected to: Master will return a Game Server to connect to. Game Server will return the joined Room's data. This is an async request which triggers a OnOperationResponse() call.
If the room is already existing, the OperationResponse will have a returnCode of ErrorCode.GameAlreadyExists.

briefdescription.para: Joins a room by name or creates new room if room with given name not exists.

detaileddescription.para: The OperationResponse depends on the server the peer is connected to: Master will return a Game Server to connect to. Game Server will return the joined Room's data. This is an async request which triggers a OnOperationResponse() call.
If the room is not existing (anymore), the OperationResponse will have a returnCode of ErrorCode.GameDoesNotExist. Other possible ErrorCodes are: GameClosed, GameFull.

simplesect.para: If the operation could be sent (requires connection).

briefdescription.para: Operation to join a random, available room.

detaileddescription.para: Overloads take additional player properties. This is an async request which triggers a OnOperationResponse() call. If all rooms are closed or full, the OperationResponse will have a returnCode of ErrorCode.NoRandomMatchFound. If successful, the OperationResponse contains a gameserver address and the name of some room.

simplesect.para: If the operation could be sent currently (requires connection).

briefdescription.para: Only used on the Master Server.

detaileddescription.para: It will assign a game server and room to join-or-create. On the Game Server, the OpJoin is used with option "create if not exists".

briefdescription.para: Leaves a room with option to come back later or "for good".

parameterdescription.para: Async games can be re-joined (loaded) later on. Set to false, if you want to abandon a game entirely.
WebFlag: Securely transmit the encrypted object AuthCookie to the web service in PathLeave webhook when available

simplesect.para: If the opteration can be send currently.

briefdescription.para: Gets a list of games matching a SQL-like where clause.

detaileddescription.para: Operation is only available in lobbies of type SqlLobby. This is an async request which triggers a OnOperationResponse() call. Returned game list is stored in RoomInfoList.

https://doc.photonengine.com/en-us/realtime/current/reference/matchmaking-and-lobby::sql_lobby_type
lobby
The lobby to query. Has to be of type SqlLobby.
queryData
The sql query statement.
If the operation could be sent (has to be connected).

briefdescription.para: Request the rooms and online status for a list of friends (each client must set a unique username via OpAuthenticate).

detaileddescription.para: Used on Master Server to find the rooms played by a selected list of users. Users identify themselves by using OpAuthenticate with a unique user ID. The list of user IDs must be fetched from some other source (not provided by Photon).

The server response includes 2 arrays of info (each index matching a friend from the request): ParameterCode.FindFriendsResponseOnlineList = bool[] of online states ParameterCode.FindFriendsResponseRoomIdList = string[] of room names (empty string if not in a room)
The options may be used to define which state a room must match to be returned.

parameterdescription.para: Array of friend's names (make sure they are unique).
Options that affect the result of the FindFriends operation.

simplesect.para: If the operation could be sent (requires connection).

memberdef.argsstring: (string appId, string appVersion, AuthenticationValues authValues, string regionCode, bool getLobbyStatistics)
memberdef.name: OpAuthenticate

briefdescription.para: Sends this app's appId and appVersion to identify this application server side.

detaileddescription.para: This is an async request which triggers a OnOperationResponse() call.

This operation makes use of encryption, if that is established before. See: EstablishEncryption(). Check encryption with IsEncryptionAvailable. This operation is allowed only once per connection (multiple calls will have ErrorCode != Ok).

parameterdescription.para: Your application's name or ID to authenticate. This is assigned by Photon Cloud (webpage).
The client's version (clients with differing client appVersions are separated and players don't meet).
Contains all values relevant for authentication. Even without account system (external Custom Auth), the clients are allowed to identify themselves.
Optional region code, if the client should connect to a specific Photon Cloud Region.
Set to true on Master Server to receive "Lobby Statistics" events.

simplesect.para: If the operation could be sent (has to be connected).

memberdef.argsstring: (string appId, string appVersion, AuthenticationValues authValues, string regionCode, EncryptionMode encryptionMode, ConnectionProtocol expectedProtocol)
memberdef.name: OpAuthenticateOnce

briefdescription.para: Sends this app's appId and appVersion to identify this application server side.

detaileddescription.para: This is an async request which triggers a OnOperationResponse() call.

This operation makes use of encryption, if that is established before. See: EstablishEncryption(). Check encryption with IsEncryptionAvailable. This operation is allowed only once per connection (multiple calls will have ErrorCode != Ok).

parameterdescription.para: Your application's name or ID to authenticate. This is assigned by Photon Cloud (webpage).
The client's version (clients with differing client appVersions are separated and players don't meet).
Optional authentication values. The client can set no values or a UserId or some parameters for Custom Authentication by a server.
Optional region code, if the client should connect to a specific Photon Cloud Region.

simplesect.para: If the operation could be sent (has to be connected).

briefdescription.para: Operation to handle this client's interest groups (for events in room).

detaileddescription.para: Note the difference between passing null and byte[0]: null won't add/remove any groups. byte[0] will add/remove all (existing) groups. First, removing groups is executed. This way, you could leave all groups and join only the ones provided.
Changes become active not immediately but when the server executes this operation (approximately RTT/2).

parameterdescription.para: Groups to remove from interest. Null will not remove any. A byte[0] will remove all.
Groups to add to interest. Null will not add any. A byte[0] will add all current.

simplesect.para: If operation could be enqueued for sending. Sent when calling: Service or SendOutgoingCommands.

memberdef.argsstring: (byte eventCode, object customEventContent, RaiseEventOptions raiseEventOptions, SendOptions sendOptions)
memberdef.name: OpRaiseEvent

briefdescription.para: Send an event with custom code/type and any content to the other players in the same room.

detaileddescription.para: This override explicitly uses another parameter order to not mix it up with the implementation for Hashtable only.

parameterdescription.para: Identifies this type of event (and the content). Your game's event codes can start with 0.
Any serializable datatype (including Hashtable like the other OpRaiseEvent overloads).
Contains (slightly) less often used options. If you pass null, the default options will be used.
Send options for reliable, encryption etc

simplesect.para: If operation could be enqueued for sending. Sent when calling: Service or SendOutgoingCommands.

briefdescription.para: Internally used operation to set some "per server" settings.

detaileddescription.para: This is for the Master Server.

parameterdescription.para: Set to true, to get Lobby Statistics (lists of existing lobbies).

simplesect.para: False if the operation could not be sent.

memberdef.argsstring: (Dictionary< byte, object > op, RoomOptions roomOptions, bool usePropertiesKey=false)
memberdef.name: RoomOptionsToOpParameters

briefdescription.para: Used by OpJoinRoom and by OpCreateRoom alike.

memberdef.argsstring: (int actorNr, Hashtable actorProperties, Hashtable expectedProperties=null, WebFlags webflags=null)
memberdef.name: OpSetPropertiesOfActor

briefdescription.para: Sets properties of a player / actor.

detaileddescription.para: Internally this uses OpSetProperties, which can be used to either set room or player properties.

parameterdescription.para: The payer ID (a.k.a. actorNumber) of the player to attach these properties to.
The properties to add or update.
If set, these must be in the current properties-set (on the server) to set actorProperties: CAS.
Set these to forward the properties to a WebHook as defined for this app (in Dashboard).

simplesect.para: If the operation could be sent (requires connection).

briefdescription.para: Sets properties of a room.

detaileddescription.para: Internally this uses OpSetProperties, which can be used to either set room or player properties.

parameterdescription.para: The properties to add or update.
The properties expected when update occurs. (CAS : "Check And Swap")
WebFlag to indicate if request should be forwarded as "PathProperties" webhook or not.

simplesect.para: If the operation could be sent (has to be connected).

briefdescription.para: A LoadBalancingPeer provides the operations and enum definitions needed to use the LoadBalancing server application which is also used in Photon Cloud.

detaileddescription.para: This class is internally used. The LoadBalancingPeer does not keep a state, instead this is done by a LoadBalancingClient.
